parts:
This site uses cookies: On logging in, a short data string is saved to your computer and on subsequent calls to this web site is submitted to confirm your identity and logged in status.
This cookie data is necessary for the operation of the site. Please do not log in if you do not accept this usage.

index_template.brief: The template for the index page
head: Part

head.brief: The head section of the page

parts.failmessage: failed to read textblocks database with ref html5shiv

body.brief: The body section of the page

parts: This is an example project, which uses an sqlite database to provide user membership and administrator logon capabilities.

When first run, or if the database file members.db is missing, a database will be created with user 'admin', password 'password' and a PIN of '1234'. Use these to log on, create new users - and change the above defaults!

If you wish to use this example as the base of your own project, do not edit skiclub directly (as future versions may be incompatable), rather use the skipole.py -c copy function to create a copy with your own project name, and edit that as you wish.

This project may be suitable for a small club or a Raspberry Pi in-house project, but currently the entire skipole framework has not been tested for security. For more serious usage the wsgi application would also need to be served via a https capable server rather than the Python default web server.
Therefore to be specific : This project should only be used for none-critical purposes. The security features are not to be relied upon.
